answers.answer: There is no doctor at this forum, you have posted at a 'patient to patient forum'.However, you can reach  the Doctor Thyroid Forum and ask Dr. Lupo athttp://www.medhelp.org/forums/show/120; ORGo to the list at right of main page, 3 down just below"Community Members", titled "Related Expert Forums"Diabetes - Adult Type II and Thyroid, click on "thyroid" it will take you to the forum.If you have posted more than one post per the sites rules for doctors forums, you probably won't get answered.  Or if the forum is full and not taking any more questions for the day, you can try another day.Good luck and Best of health!
Pregnancy can normalize a mild thyroid problem.  Just keep checking the levels, and make sure you continue to do so post-partum.

This is interesting to me. I have been mildly hypothyroid for many years, in retrospect.I felt better during my pregnancies and a friend told me that sometimes you can normalize during the pregnancy. I wasn't so sure, but I am more convinced now after reading your account and the input from chigirl29.I think I will ask my endo next visit.As chigirl29 has said, just make sure to keep tabs on your levels throughout the pregnancy and after.Congrats and good luck!

question: Hello Dr-Would appreciate your input ...Quick history:Was diagnosed as midly hypothyroid, TSH of 6.5, a few years ago and was put on 50 mcg of levoxyl. TSH was normal while on treatment.I recently became pregnant.  Was so naseous during early pregnancy that couldn't keep levoxyl down / in system.  Stopped taking for a few weeks, and had TSH tested at 6 weeks pregnant.  TSH was 1.6, so the doctor told me to not resume taking levoxyl.TSH has been tested every 6 weeks since then and has been within normal range - between 1.0 and 2.5, so have not resumed levoxyl.  Last week, at 30 weeks, TSH had crept up to 2.85.I'm a bit nervous about not taking any levoxyl, but continue to test normal TSH.Is it possible that my body's thyroid function normalized during pregnancy, given that I was only midly hypothyroid to begin with?Would you recommend that I begin treatment again now that TSH is above 2.0?Should I be worried at all, or feel comforted by normal TSH tests?  How "fail-safe" is the TSH test?Thank you so much for your help.
title: Thyroid Function Normalize During Pregnancy?
